name: Emergency First Aid for BioChem Exposure
description: Training in rapid response treatment for biological and chemical exposure in high-risk environments.

cards.title: Neutralizing Chemical Burns & Skin Exposure
cards.description: Methods for treating chemical burns, skin contact poisoning, and dermal exposure to hazardous substances.
cards.bulletpoints: Irrigation techniques, pH neutralization, barrier application
cards.summaryText: Flush and strip contaminants fast, neutralize pH swings, and reseal skin so chemical burns stop progressing.

cards.title: Emergency Airway Management in BioChem Exposure
cards.description: Procedures for clearing airways and providing oxygen support after inhalation of toxic gases or airborne bioweapons.
cards.bulletpoints: Oxygen therapy, airway clearance, assisted ventilation
cards.summaryText: Clear airways, flood lungs with clean oxygen, and assist ventilation before toxins shut down respiration.

cards.title: Antidote Administration & Rapid Detox
cards.description: Using emergency antidotes and detox agents to counteract poisons, venoms, and neurotoxins.
cards.bulletpoints: Epinephrine injections, activated charcoal, chelation therapy
cards.summaryText: Deploy the right antidote or detox protocol on contact so toxins are bound, neutralized, or flushed before systemic damage.
